This time, we have Ayano Kawamura from Angelem and Reina Ise from Angelem.
This is a program that takes you behind the scenes of the production of various artists belonging to the Upfront Group.
We will show you the process of recording and rehearsal.
Now then, let's start with a behind-the-scenes look at the two MCs.
I, Kawamura, used to eat bento (boxed lunch) at our live shows due to the influence of Corona,
But from this tour, we are back to catering.
We have been served hot soup, fish, meat, white rice, and other delicious and warm dishes,
I always have a hard time deciding which one to eat,
Akane Matsumoto always tells me, "This fish tastes delicious with this flavor,
Akane Matsumoto-chan always gives me a very detailed review of the fish, saying that it tastes good with this flavor, or the meat is delicious with this seasoning,
Akane Matsumoto always gives me a very detailed review.
I always decide on the menu after listening to her reviews,
I always do my best at the concert with a lot of energy.
I sometimes think that I shouldn't eat so much because it is before the show,
But when I heard it, I thought it sounded delicious,
I also order a normal or larger amount of food,
But I make it a rule to eat at least two hours before the show,
Usually, I decide to eat two and a half hours before the show,
This makes it easier for me to move during the show,
I have decided that I will definitely eat 2 hours and a half before the show.
Also, Akane Matsumoto has influenced me in this regard,
Akane always jumps 5 times as hard as she can just before coming out from the sleeves to the stage.
She always does it.
She always does it, so I decided to learn from her and do it before going out on stage,
It is totally different when I do it and when I don't do it,
It makes it much easier to move,
I do it too, so let's do it together.
I'm doing it myself, so let's do it together.

This song, "No Mistake, No Crying," is about changing from a girl to an adult while falling in love,
Tsubaki Factory has a lot of songs about love, but this song is the most mature among them,
The dance has a lot of mature choreography, and there are many places where we all have to play together,
I was very conscious of the fact that all 10 of us were expressing one music while each of us was expressing our individuality in our dance lessons.
Kishimoto's point of interest is that there are a lot of English lyrics in the song.
Especially in the intro, outro, and the middle of the chorus,
Among the various members singing, Marin Fukuda, who is good at English, was in charge of many of them,
She sings the English part like a rap song by herself,
Of course, her English pronunciation and such are cool,
But it is also cool to see how powerful and bold Marin is when she dances while speaking English.
I think this fits the theme of the song, from a girl to an adult,
I felt Marin's growth from the previous single to this single,
I really felt Marin's growth from the previous single to this single, so I hope you will pay attention to it.
When I saw her dancing for the first time, I thought it was really cool that she was dancing so well together,
But when I saw the dance lesson, I realized that the dancers were all dancing together,
When they open their hands, they press the piano's "Do" as if they were pressing the "Do" from the piano's "Do",
That's what Angeleum often tells us in the dance lesson,
I thought that when the hands were so open, it made it look like everyone's hands were in perfect alignment.
I was watching this dance lesson, and the choreographer, Yuka-sensei, is also in charge of Angels,
I don't know if it's the same when she sings the solo part,
I don't know if it's the same when I sing a solo part, but there are many times when I have to think up the choreography on my own,
This time, I think there may be some choreographed scenes in the solo parts, but I think there were some scenes where I had to come up with my own choreography,
I think there were some scenes where we had to come up with the choreography by ourselves,
Comparing those scenes with ours, I would often overthink things and end up looking a bit unnatural,
But I felt that everyone in Tsubaki's group moved their hands so naturally,
I thought it was very cool and smooth.
That's all I have to say about Tsubaki Factory's no-cry dance lesson.
No one can pollute the night sky, the night sky is watching over you.

My name is Shigeru Murata, bass player.
I enjoyed it. Thank you very much.
I was looking forward to it because it was a song by Beyonce, whom I originally liked.
Moreover, it was a song by Sho Hoshibe, and I was very moved to be able to play it in the way that it has Mr. Hoshibe's verses, but with the bass in fine detail.
The problem was that I could hear the members singing while I was listening.
I listen to it too much. I try not to listen to that while I play the bass guitar.
I tried to put only my soul into the music, as if I was making music.
In terms of the technical part, I tried to include the 16 fine details and the feathers in a comfortable way.
I believe that the best music is made when you are in the groove, so I put emphasis on that aspect of the music.
The part I want you to pay attention to is right before the "tete tete tete tete tete" at the end of the first chorus.
It appears three times in this song, and I put everything I had into those three times.
If you just pay attention to that part, the rest of the song itself is great. I hope you enjoy it.
I look forward to this instrumental recording every time, and this time it's the bass guitar,
I often think that the bass is very effective in cute or bright songs,
When I first heard this song, I had the impression that the bass sounded great,
When I watched the video again, I got the impression that the bass was playing all the time without a break, which I thought was amazing,
I was really impressed by the way they were playing with such a groove, and I was also impressed by the way they were playing,
I also thought it would be different if I listened to the video after watching it, so I wanted to listen to it again.
I would like to listen to it again,
The song "Tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete,
I could hear the bass guitar playing "tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete tete,
I listened to it so much and practiced so much that I could play it with my eyes closed,
I could feel how much fun it was to play, and I could feel that fun in the sound,
I think that the joy of playing the song is conveyed in the sound, and it makes the song shine even more brightly.
That's all for Beyonce, Seek Me, Destiny's Traveler, bass recording.
